attributes.action: Call a General Election prior to standing down as the Prime Minister
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The supporters of New Labour voted the party in again at the last elections. This was on the understanding that Mr Blair continued for a full term in office. As the person leading a party is a main consideration for voters, the party may not have the backing of the public when he leaves.
As Mr Brown has robbed us blind in stealth taxes, he does not seem popular and there does not appear to be anybody else capable of leading this country, in the party.
The only way to ensure that New Labour have the consent of the people has got to be an election.It does not seem democratic for the new Prime Minister to be chosen from within the ranks of New Labour.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
